availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Humphrey Marshall Woodyard (Lewis County, Missouri, attorney and lieutenant colonel (U.S.A.) )

body.p: Lewis County, Missouri, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Amelia R. Nelson in Lewis County, Missouri, on November 8, 1841. Father of Alice N. Woodyard, Nantella M. Woodyard, Marco B. Woodyard, J.N. Woodyard, and S.T. Woodyard. Attorney in Lewis County, Missouri, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Lewis County in 1850. Attorney in Lewis County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Lewis County in 1860. Served in the 21st Missouri Infantry (U.S.A.) as Lieutenant Colonel from 1862 to 1864. Died in military service on April 14, 1864, in Memphis, Missouri.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Missouri, Lewis County, District 48.

Missouri, U.S., Marriage Records, 1833-1977, Missouri State Archives, Jefferson City, MO, Lewis County.
